column2: ARKANSAS DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: AR

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for trucks entering from the side
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Steep hill

column2: 3. When driving on a roadway with a single broken white line:
column4: you may cross the broken white line to change lanes.
column6: you may not cross the broken white line.
column8: you may change lanes only if you are in the right lane.

column2: 4. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column6: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.
column8: Under no circumstances.

column2: 5. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns sharply to the left and then right
column6: turns to the right and then the left
column8: turns only to the left

column2: 6. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column6: under no circumstances.
column8: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 7. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 8. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
column6: proceed because you have the right-of-way.
column8: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.

column2: 9. On roadways, bicyclists are considered:
column6: a distraction.
column8: vehicles.

column2: 10. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.

column2: 11. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.

column2: 12. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

column2: 13. A broken yellow line to the right of a solid yellow center line means:
column6: you may pass other vehicles if no oncoming traffic is present.
column8: you are only allowed to make left turns in this area.

column2: 14. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column6: yellow; black
column8: red; white

column2: 15. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)
column8: Warning signs

column2: 16. This sign means:
column6: U-turns are not allowed.
column8: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 17. Fatigue increases the risk of:
column6: falling asleep while driving.
column8: hitting a roadblock.

column2: 18. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
column6: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column8: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.

column2: 19. This sign indicates:
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Warning: drunk drivers.

column2: 20. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
column6: over your shoulders.
column8: in your side mirrors.

column2: 21. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 22. When merging onto an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: turn on their emergency flashers right before merging.
column6: always stop before entering the highway.
column8: select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.

column2: 23. Stopping distances:
column6: are not affected by vehicle speed.
column8: decrease as vehicle speed increases.

column2: 24. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column6: drink coffee.
column8: get some rest or change drivers.

column2: 25. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.
column6: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.
column8: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.
